agency.tip: General responsibility for occupational safety and compliance with the Working Time Act
agency.details: As far as possible, taking care of the above-mentioned issues and implementation methods should be agreed upon already at the stage of concluding the customer contract. However, some issues can be left to be reviewed or agreed upon only during the employee's order phase. This is the way to go, at least when the job description of temporary workers is not yet known exactly.

agency2.tip: Responsibility for compliance with the Working Time Act
Insuring employees against work accidents and occupational diseases
Ensuring the fulfillment of the user company's obligations
Ensuring the temporary worker's sufficient professional skills and suitability for work

business2.tip: Providing the necessary information to the agency
Notifying the agency of the professional requirements and special features required for the job
Investigation and assessment of work hazards
Reporting to the workplace's occupational health service and occupational health and safety representative
Drawing up an occupational health and safety action program
Orientation of the temporary employee to work and working conditions

Responsibility for the work management and supervision of temporary workers (here below the key requirements, e.g. responsibility for taking care of occupational safety and health during work, ensuring the use of necessary personal protective equipment and safety equipment, compliance with working time legislation)
Occupational health and safety responsibility in a shared workplace

worker2.tip: Compliance with the employer's instructions and regulations
Taking care of your own safety and that of your colleagues
Appropriate use of work tools, personal protective equipment and safety devices
Report of detected defects and deficiencies

yhtenäinen.tip: Shared occupational health and safety responsibility (with the user company, shared box)
General responsibility for occupational safety (key requirements below, e.g.
* Investigation and assessment of work hazards
* Drawing up an occupational health and safety action program
* Organization of occupational health and safety cooperation
* Orientation (including giving a general orientation to the temporary worker)
* Reporting the use of young workers in hazardous work
* Notification of a serious accident at work to occupational safety and health authorities and the police)
Procurement of the necessary personal protective equipment (in cooperation with the user company, shared box)
